attributes.action: Give the NHS the £10,000 each MP is getting for working at home.
attributes.additional_details:
MP's already have expenses covered and an office budget so they could use those to cover any extra costs incurred while working from home. They don't need an extra £10,000 just because they are working from home. 

A huge proportion of the country is doing that right now and they don't get extra money so why should MP's have money thrown at them when the NHS is so desperate for money.

Hopefully some of the money could be used as bonuses or a pay increase for the staff that more than deserve it.
attributes.background: Give the £10,000 extra that MP's are due to get to the NHS instead.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for MPs' pay. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/
